result.execSummary:
The defendant Daymond M Wortham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to pay all costs fees and surcharges by 4-05-2016 or civil judgment. 
*Court orders any bail on deposit to be returned to poster.  
*Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant  successfully completes 50 hours of community service within 6 months, pays all costs, fees and surcharges and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
*Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, with Huber Privileges for work.  Court stays report date to 10-10-2015 by 9:00 am.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daymond M Wortham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant  successfully completes 50 hours of community service within 6 months, pays all costs, fees and surcharges and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Daymond M Wortham in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.    Student Intern Patrick O'Keefe under the supervision ofAlex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  Additional statements by Lakeesha F.  
Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, with Huber Privileges for work.  Court stays report date to 10-10-2015 by 9:00 am.
Defendant to pay all costs fees and surcharges by 4-05-2016 or civil judgment. 
Court orders any bail on deposit to be returned to poster.  

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant  successfully completes 50 hours of community service within 6 months, pays all costs, fees and surcharges and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

filed: sentencing referral form

Defendant Daymond M Wortham in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing date in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daymond M Wortham in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for status of counsel.  State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a status conference date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daymond M Wortham in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant requests additional time to hire an attorney.  Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daymond M Wortham in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-096

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.
